intro: Rubus ortivus, commonly known as the common blackberry bush, is a species of bramble native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which are typically trifoliate. The plant produces aggregate fruits known as blackberries, which are dark purple to black when ripe. These fruits are rich in antioxidants and are widely used in culinary applications. Rubus ortivus thrives in temperate climates and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges.
